IgY antibody (capture antibody) was prepared at a concentration of 100 μg/ml in coating buffer (1 M, pH = 9.6) ( Figure 8). Samples (100 μL) were added to a 96-well flat-bottom plate (n = 5) and incubated at 4 °C overnight. After washing three times with 1 M PBS (pH = 7) containing 0.05% Tween-20, 100 μL of 5% BSA (in PBS) was added and incubated for 1 h at 37 °C. Subsequently, the plate was washed three more times, and 100 μl of the M2e peptide (positive control) and the prepared swab samples were loaded on the plate and incubated at 37 °C for 2 h. The plate was washed again, and 100 μl of the synthesized IgY-ALP bioconjugate was added to each well and incubated for 2 h at 37 °C. Then, the plate was washed seven times. The substrate pNPP was added, and absorbance values were measured at 405 nm with a multiscan spectrophotometer after incubation at 37 °C for 1 h.
